item.title: Samsung Galaxy Ring 2 set to launch with AI features and IP69 Rating: Details - India TV News
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy Ring 2 Set to Launch with AI Features and IP69 Rating

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India TV News

Samsung is poised to launch the Galaxy Ring 2, featuring advanced AI capabilities and improved durability. It may debut at the Galaxy Unpacked event on January 22, 2025.

  • Increased size options from nine to eleven for better fit.
  • Enhanced battery life offering up to 7 days on a single charge.
  • Improved durability with an IP69 rating for superior water resistance.
  • AI-driven upgrades making the smart ring more intuitive and versatile.
“With its AI-driven upgrades, wider size options, improved battery life, and IP69 rating, the Galaxy Ring 2 promises to redefine smart wearables.”

The Galaxy Ring 2 is highly anticipated, following Samsung's successful history with smart wearables, potentially setting new standards in the market.

item.title: OnePlus Open 2 alleged leaks suggest upgraded design, IPX8 rating, and Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC | Mint - Mint
item.description:
OnePlus Open 2 alleged leaks suggest upgraded design, IPX8 rating, and Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: Live Mint

Tech giant OnePlus is reportedly gearing up to launch the OnePlus Open 2, a successor to its 2023 foldable model, scheduled for early next year. Leaks suggest significant upgrades in design and specifications.

  • Refined design featuring a larger circular camera module with a rearranged triple-camera setup.
  • IPX8 water resistance rating, an improvement over the IPX4 rating of its predecessor.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, with options for up to 16GB RAM and 1TB storage.
  • Display specs include an 8-inch LTPO main screen with 2K resolution and 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Expected camera capabilities: triple 50MP rear sensors and dual selfie cameras (32MP and 20MP).
  • 5,900mAh battery with 80W wired fast charging support.

As OnePlus prepares for the global launch of its flagship OnePlus 13 on January 7, 2025, the OnePlus 12 has also seen a price reduction, making it an attractive option for buyers seeking a premium smartphone at a lower cost.

item.title: iPhone 17 Pro details leak: Everything we know - India Today
item.description:
iPhone 17 Pro Details Leak: What We Know So Far

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 | Source: India Today

Recent leaks provide insights into the anticipated designs and features of the iPhone 17 Pro series, potentially signaling significant changes.

  • The camera design is rumored to resemble that of the Google Pixel 9 series.
  • There are suggestions that the iPhone 17 Pro may maintain a traditional design rather than adopting a new look.
  • Apple is expected to revert from a titanium frame back to aluminum.
  • A dual-tone rear panel is anticipated for the iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max.
  • Metalens camera technology could be introduced, allowing for a smaller Dynamic Island cutout.
  • The newer models may feature thinner bezels for an improved screen design.
  • The 5x Telephoto optical zoom lens will remain a Pro-exclusive feature.
  • Easier battery removal is anticipated, following technology introduced in the iPhone 16 series.
  • The iPhone 17 Air is also expected to launch with an upgraded chipset and a lower price point.
"The iPhone 17 Air is expected to cost just like the Plus variants and lower than the Pro models." - India Today

The iPhone 17 Pro series is shaping up to be an exciting release, with various rumors hinting at meaningful design and functional enhancements.

item.title: Tipsters Leak OnePlus Open 2 Alleged Renders, Slimmer Design Expected - ABP Live
item.description:
Tipsters Leak OnePlus Open 2 Alleged Renders, Slimmer Design Expected

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Smartprix

The upcoming OnePlus Open 2 is set to debut early next year, featuring a slimmer profile and upgraded specifications compared to its predecessor.

  • Expected to use the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
  • Leaked renders show a larger camera module with a new design layout.
  • Rumored to have an IPX8 water resistance rating.
  • Display expected to be 8-inch LTPO with a 2K resolution.
  • Triple rear camera setup: 50 MP + 50 MP + 50 MP for various photography needs.
  • Expected to have a battery capacity of 5,900 mAh.
"OnePlus Open 2. Larger yet thinner than the OnePlus Open (sub-10 mm folded). IPX8 rating (vs. IPX4 on the Open)." — Noah Cat

This smartphone is anticipated to compete closely with the upcoming Oppo Find N5, expected to launch shortly after.

item.title: Tech that listens, talks back: Kashyap Kompella lists his top finds of 2024 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prompt assistants, smart glasses, an app to decode the night sky — it’s been a tricky year to balance digital abundance with security and privacy, but here’s the tech year wrapped.

Date: Dec 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the top tech finds of 2024, highlighting key innovations in apps and gadgets.

  • MacWhisper: A reliable transcription tool built on OpenAI’s Whisper model.
  • PromptPerfect: A tool that transforms simple sentences into detailed prompts for AI assistants.
  • NotebookLM: Generates audio summaries from large documents, enhancing AI interaction.
  • Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses: Look innocent but can take photos and videos.
  • Quick-commerce apps are becoming more common but can be inefficient.
  • Three small innovations that improve daily life: a silent haptic alarm, School of Life app, and Sky Guide app.
“I cannot adequately express the joy of waking up to a vibrating alert on my wrist that has disturbed no one else.”

The article captures Kashyap Kompella's insights on innovative tech tools and their impact on privacy and convenience.

item.title: YouTube’s new ‘Play Something’ button could help put a stop to your endless scrolling woes - The Indian Express
item.description:
YouTube experimenting with new ‘Play Something’ button: Here’s what it does

Date: December 2024 Source: Indian Express

YouTube is testing a new “Play something” button aimed at improving user experience by helping viewers find videos more easily. This button plays a random video in the Shorts player or traditional content in portrait mode.

  • The button features a black background with white text.
  • Tapping it begins playback of random videos in the Shorts format.
  • The button disappears when the mini-player is active.
  • This is not the first attempt; earlier versions were noticed in 2023.
  • The rollout of the button is still uncertain.
“Can’t decide what to watch?” – Previous message associated with the Play something button.

The new button aims to enhance user engagement by reducing the time spent scrolling for content.

item.title: The rise and reign of India’s beauty baroness Shahnaz Husain | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
The Rise and Reign of Shahnaz Husain: India's Beauty Baroness

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: Company Business News

Shahnaz Husain, turning 80 last month, is celebrated as a pioneer in organic green beauty in India, influencing the beauty industry long before the term 'influencer' became popular. She combined her marketing savvy with a forward-thinking approach to beauty trends.

  • Recognized as one of India's original influencers, shaping beauty standards since the 1970s.
  • Established a highly sought-after brand with a strong identity centered around her name.
  • Her marketing strategy inspired thousands of women to pursue her beauty products.
“Such was the power of her marketing that thousands of young women wanted a totemic vial of cream from Shahnaz Husain.”

Shahnaz Husain's legacy demonstrates the empowerment of women in entrepreneurship and the impact of innovative marketing in the beauty sector.

item.title: iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus And iPhone SE 3 Will Not Be Sold In These Countries, Check The Full List - Times Now
item.description:
Apple Discontinues iPhone 14 and iPhone SE 3 Sales in Several EU Countries

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times Now

Apple has officially removed the iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Plus, and the third-generation iPhone SE from its online store in several EU countries due to new regulations on smartphone charging ports.

  • Apple's decision affects countries within the EU, including France, Germany, Italy, Belgium, and more.
  • The UK is not affected, but Northern Ireland is due to EU single market rules.
  • Availability of these models in stores may vary as remaining stock is sold out.
  • A fourth-generation iPhone SE with USB-C is expected to be announced in March.
"The iPhone 14 and iPhone 14 Plus likely would have been discontinued in September had the USB-C regulation not existed, so sales are ending in the EU around nine months early."

In conclusion, Apple's move to discontinue these models in the EU highlights the impact of new regulations on product availability and future device expectations.

item.title: POCO C75 5G: A Budget King or a Missed Opportunity - Analytics Insight
item.description:
POCO C75 5G: A Budget King or a Missed Opportunity

Published on: 28 Dec 2024, 3:30 am

The POCO C75 5G is being reviewed as a budget-friendly smartphone offering impressive features at an affordable price.

  • Affordable Price: Priced at ₹8,499, it stands out as budget-friendly.
  • Large Display: Features a 6.88-inch HD+ IPS LCD with a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • Battery Life: Boasts a 5160mAh battery for all-day usage.
  • Unique Design: Includes a stylish marbled back and an IP52 rating for durability.
  • Decent Performance: Uses Qualcomm Snapdragon 4s Gen 2 for reliable day-to-day tasks.
  • Camera Performance: The 50MP camera works well in bright conditions but has limitations in low light.
  • Storage: 64GB internal storage, expandable with microSD, but may lag during heavy multitasking.

item.title: Tech this week: vivo Y29 5G, Lava Yuva 2 and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Latest Tech Releases This Week: vivo Y29 5G, Lava Yuva 2 and More

Publication Date: December 2023 Source: CNBC TV18

This week in tech, major companies have unveiled new products including the vivo Y29 5G smartphone and the Lava Yuva 2, along with updates on Samsung microSD cards and upcoming releases from Xiaomi and OPPO.

  • vivo Y29 5G: Launched in India, featuring a 6.64-inch LCD, MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset, and priced at ₹13,999.
  • Lava Yuva 2: 5G smartphone priced at ₹9,499 with unique backlight design and 5000mAh battery.
  • Samsung microSD cards: New series based on Sonic the Hedgehog, combining speed and durability.
  • Xiaomi Pad 7: Set to launch in India on January 10, with up to 12GB RAM and 256GB storage.
  • OPPO Reno 13 series: Expected launch for the series in January 2025 in India.
“The smartphone features a 6.64-inch LCD display with a 120Hz refresh rate and 1,000 nits brightness.”

In conclusion, these new launches reflect ongoing innovation and competition within the tech industry as companies gear up for the new year.

Vivo is preparing for an exciting 2025 with leaked information about the launch of the Vivo X200 Ultra and plans for future smartphone models.

item.title: WhatsApp Introduces Document Scanning Feature, But Only For iPhone Users For Now - News18
item.description:
WhatsApp Introduces Document Scanning Feature Exclusively for iPhone Users

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: News18 Hindi

WhatsApp has rolled out a new document scanning feature for iPhone users, allowing them to scan documents directly within the app without needing third-party applications. This addition is aimed at enhancing user experience and increasing efficiency in document sharing.

Key Points

  • The feature is exclusively available for iOS users for now.
  • Users must update to the latest version of WhatsApp to access the feature.
  • The scanning process involves opening a chat, selecting 'Documents', and using the camera to scan.
  • Adjustments such as cropping and modifying contrast/brightness can be made after scanning.
  • Android users can expect the feature to be rolled out in the coming weeks.

Notable Quotes

“This feature eliminates the need for users to switch to third-party apps to scan documents.”

Conclusion

WhatsApp's new scanning feature represents a significant enhancement for iPhone users, making document sharing seamless and integrated within the app itself.

item.title: SCIENCE NOTEBOOK | More Efficient Quantum Computing, Aggressive Lowering of BP of Type 2 Diabetes Patients, and Heat-Related Mortality Due to Climate Change - Frontline
item.description:
SCIENCE NOTEBOOK | More Efficient Quantum Computing, Aggressive Lowering of BP of Type 2 Diabetes Patients, and Heat-Related Mortality Due to Climate Change

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: The Hindu

This article discusses recent developments in quantum computing, the health impacts of aggressive blood pressure management in type 2 diabetes patients, and alarming trends in heat-related mortality due to climate change.

  • Researchers from the University of Sydney developed a new quantum architecture for more efficient error correction in quantum computing.
  • Intensive blood pressure lowering in type 2 diabetes patients can significantly reduce cardiovascular risks, according to a large study.
  • The Lancet Countdown report reveals unprecedented health risks due to climate change, including a dramatic rise in heat-related mortality among older adults.
“The latest Lancet Countdown report... makes it clear: Climate change is not a distant threat, but an immediate risk to health.” - Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, Director-General of WHO

In conclusion, the articles emphasize the importance of innovation in quantum technology and health initiatives alongside urgent action to address public health risks associated with climate change.

item.title: New OnePlus Pad makes a surprise debut in China with MediaTek chip - 9to5Google
item.description:
New OnePlus Pad makes a surprise debut in China with MediaTek chip

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: 9to5Google

OnePlus has revealed a new tablet in China, featuring MediaTek's latest Dimensity 8350 chipset and an 11.6-inch high-resolution display.

  • The OnePlus Pad comes with a 2.8K display with a refresh rate of 144Hz.
  • Internally powered by MediaTek Dimensity 8350, it offers configurations with either 8GB or 12GB of RAM.
  • The tablet has a robust 9,520mAh battery with 67W fast charging capabilities.
  • Priced at CNY 1,999 (approximately $274), it aims to be a budget-friendly device.
  • This launch is positioned as a rebranded version of the Oppo Pad 3, demonstrating the close collaboration between OnePlus and Oppo.
“The Oppo Pad 3 was the first tablet to come equipped with the new Dimensity chip, which has slightly more power than the Dimensity 8300.”

Overall, the new OnePlus Pad stands out with competitive specifications in the budget category, although it may remain exclusive to the Chinese market for now.

item.title: Circle to Search now on Nothing Phone (2a), Phone (2a) Plus and more: How to activate the feature - Mint
item.description:
Circle to Search Now Available on Nothing Phones

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Google’s innovative Circle to Search feature has expanded to Nothing smartphones, allowing users to access detailed information by drawing a circle around on-screen content.

  • The feature is now available on Nothing Phone (2), Phone (2a), and Phone (2a) Plus models running Nothing OS 3.0.
  • To activate, users navigate to Settings > Special features > Gestures > Navigation mode > Circle to Search.
  • Compatible with gesture navigation and traditional navigation modes.
  • Circle to Search simplifies searching for text, images, or locations without copying and pasting.
  • Upcoming enhancements may include searching within videos.
  • The feature's debut was with the Galaxy S24 series and has since attracted Android users.
“Circle to Search continues to reshape Android’s approach to intuitive and efficient search functionality.”

In conclusion, Nothing smartphones now offer enhanced search functionality with Circle to Search, reflecting ongoing innovation in Android's user experience.
